name: Kitchen Gizmo Snap N' Strain - Silicone Clip-On Colander, Heat Resistant Drainer for Vegetables and Pasta Noodles, Kitchen Gadgets for Bowl, Pots, and Pans - Essential Home Cooking Tools - Grey
about_this_item: Hands-Free Straining: This clip on strainer easily snaps onto pots, pans, and bowls; keeping your hands free. It’s a fun addition to your strainers and colanders collection; simple for draining pasta or veggies
Compact and Space-Saving: Unlike traditional strainers, this collapsible strainer clips on and takes up minimal space. It’s the go-to solution for limited kitchen storage or camping trips
Heat Resistant: Made from heat-resistant silicone; it can handle temperatures up to 400°F/230°C. This pot strainer stays strong, giving you a sturdy grip while draining hot foods without bending
Compatible with Most Cookware: Specially designed to attach to most pots, pans, and bowls; this clip-on strainer for pots is versatile. Its universal design suits any kitchen task, big or small

Durable and Dishwasher Safe: This pasta strainer is built to last; crafted from silicone; this kitchen tool is sturdy yet flexible, making draining easy. Simply rinse or pop it in the dishwasher for easy cleaning

title: Works exactly the way it was described.
content: Draining food

content: The product was pretty nice, overall.  I was worried about the clips not being strong enough, but they were plenty strong to hang onto the pot I tried it on.  I expect that'll decay over time, though.  The strain worked well.

title: Decent, though I would definitely go for a larger version.
content: My only real complaint about the item is that the strainer wall just isn't high enough.  I cooked only 1lb of meat in a 10in pan and struggled to keep the meat in the pan as I tilted to get the grease out.  All of the images show thing thing being used with pan tilted like 80º backwards.  Which is great to get "some" of the liquid out, but you have to tilt more than 90º for realistic usage, and that's where things start to try and fall over the top.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: Again, like the item, and will continue to use it.  But I would definitely like one with a bigger wall.  The same seems to be using it on a small pot, but for anything with a larger diameter, the strainer only covers like 20% of the opening.  For spaghetti, I'll definitely continue using my https://a.co/d/f5b9b94 instead, though.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: This product does what it purports to do: it keeps the pasta in the pot and lets the water out if you're like me. And you just really, really, really hate getting a separate sieve out to drain your pasta and then you always have to put it back in the pot to make whatever you're making, especially mac and cheese, right? Then get this, pour the water out, leave the pasta in the pot. You're not transferring it back and forth. Throw your butter in through your powdered in your milk. Boom bang bang mac and cheese in one pot and you're not dirtying another thing..

title: Limited use
content: It is high quality, and convenient in storing and draining pasta. But it is not super accessible in terms of the clamps. title: Verified Purchase
content: I bought this because some of my family members have a hard time straining hot liquids. I'm old school and normally just hold the lid while I drain the water and "tough out" the steam but I used it once just to see how it worked and was pleasantly surprised at how well it worked.  It seems relatively sturdy, but I'm not sure how long it will last since the "grips" are covered spring clips.
